intro: Thrixspermum xantholeucum, commonly known as the yellow-leaved thrixspermum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to yellow. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a leathery texture, which helps it conserve water in its natural habitat. Thrixspermum xantholeucum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
